chargeHist.descr: Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury

result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel K McCarthy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Samuel K McCarthy not in court.  Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DEFENDANT IS DECEASED.
ANY FINE/FORFEITURES, COSTS, ASSESSMENTS AND SURCHARGES TO BE WAIVED.
ANY OUTSTANDING CIVIL JUDGMENTS, FINE & COST COMMITMENTS, SUSPENSIONS FOR DRIVING PRIVILEGES TO BE VACATED AND/OR WITHDRAWN.

Attorney Joshua Davis Uller in court, defendant Samuel K McCarthy not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for restitution hearing.  For reasons stated on the record, the Court upholds the restitution decision made during the sentencing hearing on 04/16/2015.

Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve  9 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 70 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 2 YEARS probation.


As to Count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve  9 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 0 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 2 YEARS probation.



  Conditions of Probation:
- 60 days condition time with Huber for work.  Court stayed commencement until 05/08/2015 at 5:00pm.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens as deemed appropriate.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $10,000 payable to Accident Fund Holdings, Inc.; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied. 

Filed:  
Victim Impact Statement    
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

As to Count 1: Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

As to Count 2: Defendant advised of constitutional rights and of maximum penalties, waived all rights and plead NO CONTEST.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights received and filed.  Stipulation by state and defense to complaint as factual basis to sustain plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Defendant Samuel K McCarthy in court with attorney Joshua D. Uller.  Thomas Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information and waives formal reading.  
Court ordered charges amended to Count 1: Obstructing an Officer, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes sections 946.41(1) and 939.51(3)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor, and Count 2: Resisting an Officer contrary to Wisconsin Statutes sections 946.41(1) and 939.51(3)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor.  Restitution hearing scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

15RM014005  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
03-13-15

Attorney Joshua D. Uller in court, defendant Samuel K McCarthy not in court, in custody.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case heard off the record.  Case scheduled for plea/sentencing.  Court in trial. Case adjourned to branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Joshua D. Uller in court, defendant Samuel K McCarthy not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Samuel K McCarthy in court with attorney Joshua D. Uller.  Defendant Samuel K McCarthy in custody.  Michael Kessler, student intern under the supervision of Thomas Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Justin Anderson-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SCOTT E'S TAVERN, 3800 S 108TH ST.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Samuel K McCarthy in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  Defendant Samuel K McCarthy in custody.  Sarra M. Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WITKOWIAK, Branch 22.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
